6.text:
Hello, and welcome to 
  the seven people who worked out

12.text:
and here's my top ten best things 
        about leaving school.

15.text:
I did want to do the top ten people 
            on my hit list,

17.text:
but, as the BBC 
      quite rightly inform me,

20.text:
five of them were libellous, 
      three were already dead

25.text:
On top of which, that only makes 
     nine, which "isn't enough"

30.text:
for a "top ten", according to 
  the sharp-eyed boffins at the BBC.

37.text:
So, number one. 
    Leaving school has given me

40.text:
a lot of time to participate 
      in interesting hobbies.

44.text: and I love the swimming pool

45.text:
because in there I can do 
     my two favourite things -

48.text: urinate in public and drown people.

52.text:
One of the best things about 
  leaving school is having all day

55.text:
to sit and watch television. 
    I watch an awful lot of TV.

58.text:
I'll tell you how you know 
   when you're watching too much.

60.text: I was reading the Bible recently

63.text:
and, in the bit where 
    they put Jesus in the tomb,

65.text: I was half expecting him to shout,

67.text:
"I'm a celebrity, get me out of 
  here" and then Ant and Dec to appear

71.text:
and make our Lord and Saviour 
    gnaw on a kangaroo bollock.

75.text:
Not having to sit 
       through dull lessons.

77.text: I remember once I got a report card

79.text:
back from my science teacher, 
             Mr Smith,

81.text: where he said I was underachieving.

84.text:
That's because I found him to be 
  apocalyptically under-interesting.

91.text:
I came second 
      in Britain's Got Talent.

93.text: You can't do better than that.

98.text:
Not having to suffer teachers 
         with bad breath.

101.text:
What I've learnt is the teachers 
    with the really bad breath,

104.text: they like to get the closest

105.text:
and, from the smell, I can only 
  assume that a teacher's breakfast

108.text:
consists of three-day-old 
        cheese, rotten eggs

111.text:
and some sort of animal carcass 
   that's been ravaged by foxes

116.text:
and left out in the rain 
       for two to three days.

118.text:
The great thing 
   about leaving school, though,

121.text:
is that I now have sovereignty 
          over what I eat.

123.text:
If I want to eat 
     a McDonalds for breakfast,

126.text:
I can, without Jamie Oliver 
   coming in and crying about it.

129.text:
Don't get me wrong, 
  I don't mind my school dinners,

132.text:
cos where else can you eat sponge 
  and custard at 12 in the afternoon

135.text:
without appearing on 
  a Channel 5 weight-loss documentary?

137.text:
The answer - my house, 
        since I left school.

141.text:
These days, the Six O'Clock News has 
   become my version of This Morning.

144.text:
I reckon somebody completely 
   paralysed in a hot-air balloon

148.text:
tragedy would find it difficult 
   to spend more time in his bed

155.text:
Now that I've left school, 
       the world is my oyster

158.text:
and I greet every day 
     with a positive attitude.

160.text: I'm going to get stuff done today.

164.text:
begin to get to grips with another 
     language, or write a novel.

167.text:
Ah, no, it turns out I just sat 
        and watched Netflix

169.text:
and played Football Manager 
      for 12 hours straight.

174.text:
Not having to suffer supply teachers 
      who are out of their depth.

176.text:
Here's one for you - what do you 
  call a supply teacher with a lisp?

182.text:
Lots of things, 
       and then they go home

184.text:
and cry themselves to sleep 
   and you never see them again.

188.text: You've got to be careful, though.

192.text:
and they might end up beating a kid 
    over the head with a metal bin.

197.text: We're hoping he wakes up soon.

200.text:
These morons who go around 
  doing and saying terrible things

203.text:
and think that if they say "banter" 
    after them, that makes it fine.

207.text:
"Oh, I karate-kicked an old lady 
  down the steps of the school bus,

210.text:
"but it was for bants, so that 
  legally absolves me all guilt."

214.text:
"Oh, Donald Trump is going 
     to kill all the Mexicans,

216.text:
"but it's just for bants, 
     so chill out, would ya?"

219.text:
Anyway, the absolute 
         best thing for me

222.text:
about leaving school is being able 
      to continue my unrelenting

227.text:
and antisocial behaviour 
  against science teacher Mr Smith.

232.text:
You know? He said 
       I was underachieving.

234.text: Anyway, I've got his car keys.

238.text:
'Come out with your hands up. 
    We've got you surrounded.'

241.text:
Can I just finish this? 
         It's for the BBC.

249.text:
'Oh, that's gone online now, hasn't 
   it? Yeah, no, that's not enough.

252.text:
'Come on out, Mr Carroll, 
        you're surrounded.'

255.text: Right. Well, there you have it.

259.text:
and there's my top ten best things 
        about leaving school.
